This theme uses Bootstrap for styling. Here’re some stuff you should know before using it. To learn more, check out Bootstrap’s documentation.

Headings

h1 tags are reserved for the post title. Don’t use them. Use h2 tags mostly, and use h3 if you need subheadings. Or just edit stylesheets/style.css

Paragraphs

This is a regular paragraph. Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry’s standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book.

Links look like this. Emphasis. Marked. Deleted. Code. user-input.

Blockquotes

This is a blockquote. Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry’s standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book.

Lists

Tables

You don’t need to add the Bootstrap .table class to table. This is how it works.

name type link
Jekyll BlogEngine jekyllrb.com

Code

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('jekyll')
#=> prints 'Hi, jekyll' to STDOUT.

Images

Images are responsive.

That’s it!
